t: Psalm 106
Give Thanks to the Lord, for He Is Good
Praise*pn the Lord!*s Oh*ln give thanks to the Lord,*s for he is good, for*ld his steadfast love endures forever!
Who*ln can utter the mighty deeds of the Lord,*s or*ld declare all his praise?
Blessed*ln are they who observe justice, who*ld do righteousness at all times!
Remember*pn me, O Lord,*s when you show favor to your people; help*ld me when you save them,
that*ln I may look upon the prosperity of your chosen ones, that*ld I may rejoice in the gladness of your nation, that*ld I may glory with your inheritance.
Both*pn we and our fathers have sinned; we*ld have committed iniquity; we have done wickedness.
Our*ln fathers, when they were in Egypt, did*ld not consider your wondrous works; they*ln did not remember the abundance of your steadfast love, but*ld rebelled by the sea, at the Red Sea.
Yet*ln he saved them for his name’s sake, that*ld he might make known his mighty power.
He*ln rebuked the Red Sea, and it became dry, and*ld he led them through the deep as through a desert.
So*ln he saved them from the hand of the foe and*ld redeemed them from the power of the enemy.
And*ln the waters covered their adversaries; not*ld one of them was left.
Then*ln they believed his words; they*ld sang his praise.
But*pn they soon forgot his works; they*ld did not wait for his counsel.
But*ln they had a wanton craving in the wilderness, and*ld put God to the test in the desert;
he*ln gave them what they asked, but*ld sent a wasting disease among them.
When*pn men in the camp were jealous of Moses and*ld Aaron, the holy one of the Lord,*s
the*ln earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and*ld covered the company of Abiram.
Fire*ln also broke out in their company; the*ld flame burned up the wicked.
They*pn made a calf in Horeb and*ld worshiped a metal image.
They*ln exchanged the glory of God for*ld the image of an ox that eats grass.
They*ln forgot God, their Savior, who*ld had done great things in Egypt,
wondrous*ln works in the land of Ham, and*ld awesome deeds by the Red Sea.
Therefore*ln he said he would destroy them— had*ld not Moses, his chosen one, stood*ln in the breach before him, to*ld turn away his wrath from destroying them.
Then*pn they despised the pleasant land, having*ld no faith in his promise.
They*ln murmured in their tents, and*ld did not obey the voice of the Lord.*s
Therefore*ln he raised his hand and swore to them that*ld he would make them fall in the wilderness,
and*ln would make their offspring fall among the nations, scattering*ld them among the lands.
Then*pn they yoked themselves to the Baal of Peor, and*ld ate sacrifices offered to the dead;
they*ln provoked the Lord*s to anger with their deeds, and*ld a plague broke out among them.
Then*ln Phinehas stood up and intervened, and*ld the plague was stayed.
And*ln that was counted to him as righteousness from*ld generation to generation forever.
They*pn angered him at the waters of Meribah, and*ld it went ill with Moses on their account,
for*ln they made his spirit bitter, and*ld he spoke rashly with his lips.
They*pn did not destroy the peoples, as*ld the Lord*s commanded them,
but*ln they mixed with the nations and*ld learned to do as they did.
They*ln served their idols, which*ld became a snare to them.
They*ln sacrificed their sons and*ld their daughters to the demons;
they*ln poured out innocent blood, the*ld blood of their sons and daughters, whom*ln they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan, and*ld the land was polluted with blood.
Thus*ln they became unclean by their acts, and*ld played the whore in their deeds.
Then*pn the anger of the Lord*s was kindled against his people, and*ld he abhorred his heritage;
he*ln gave them into the hand of the nations, so*ld that those who hated them ruled over them.
Their*ln enemies oppressed them, and*ld they were brought into subjection under their power.
Many*ln times he delivered them, but*ld they were rebellious in their purposes and*ld were brought low through their iniquity.
Nevertheless,*pn he looked upon their distress, when*ld he heard their cry.
For*ln their sake he remembered his covenant, and*ld relented according to the abundance of his steadfast love.
He*ln caused them to be pitied by*ld all those who held them captive.
Save*pn us, O Lord*s our God, and*ld gather us from among the nations, that*ln we may give thanks to your holy name and*ld glory in your praise.
Blessed*pn be the Lord,*s the God of Israel, from*ld everlasting to everlasting! And*ln let all the people say, “Amen!” Praise*ld the Lord!*s
